an3.50:4.1: “Mendicants, a master thief with three factors breaks into houses, plunders wealth, steals from isolated buildings, and commits highway robbery.
an3.50:4.3: A master thief relies on uneven ground, on thick cover, and on powerful individuals.
an3.50:4.4: And how does a master thief rely on uneven ground?
an3.50:4.5: It’s when a master thief relies on a river that’s hard to cross, or rugged mountains.
an3.50:4.6: That’s how a master thief relies on uneven ground.
an3.50:5.1: And how does a master thief rely on thick cover?
an3.50:5.2: It’s when a master thief relies on thick grass, thick trees, a ridge, or a large dense wood.
an3.50:5.3: That’s how a master thief relies on thick cover.
an3.50:6.1: And how does a master thief rely on powerful individuals?
an3.50:6.2: It’s when a master thief relies on rulers or their ministers.
an3.50:6.4: ‘If anyone accuses me of anything, these rulers or their ministers will speak in my defense in the case.’
an3.50:6.6: That’s how a master thief relies on powerful individuals.
an3.50:6.7: A master thief with these three factors breaks into houses, plunders wealth, steals from isolated buildings, and commits highway robbery.
an3.50:7.1: So too, when a bad mendicant has three factors, they keep themselves broken and damaged. They deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they make much bad karma.
an3.50:7.3: A bad mendicant relies on uneven ground, on thick cover, and on powerful individuals.
an3.50:8.1: And how does a bad mendicant rely on uneven ground?
an3.50:8.2: It’s when a bad mendicant has unethical conduct by way of body, speech, and mind.
an3.50:8.3: That’s how a bad mendicant relies on uneven ground.
an3.50:9.1: And how does a bad mendicant rely on thick cover?
an3.50:9.2: It’s when a bad mendicant has wrong view, he’s attached to an extremist view.
an3.50:9.3: That’s how a bad mendicant relies on thick cover.
an3.50:10.1: And how does a bad mendicant rely on powerful individuals?
an3.50:10.2: It’s when a bad mendicant relies on rulers or their ministers.
an3.50:10.4: ‘If anyone accuses me of anything, these rulers or their ministers will speak in my defense in the case.’
an3.50:10.6: That’s how a bad mendicant relies on powerful individuals.
an3.50:10.7: When a bad mendicant has these three factors, they keep themselves broken and damaged. They deserve to be blamed and criticized by sensible people, and they make much bad karma.”
